articles.author: Kirstie McDermott
articles.title: 3 great companies for data science jobs
articles.description: If you’re working in data science, you’ve made a smart career choice. And if you don’t yet work in the field, what are you waiting for?
articles.content:
Join top executives in San Francisco on July 11-12, to hear how leaders are integrating and optimizing AI investments for success. Learn More
If youre working in data science, congratulations youve … [+1349 chars]
articles.summary:
1. Data science is a rapidly growing field with high demand for skilled professionals.
2. Companies like IBM, Accenture, and Capgemini offer great opportunities for data scientists.
3. Candidates with expertise in machine learning, Python, and SQL have a particularly competitive edge in the job market.

articles.title: Overwhelmed With High Volumes Of Customer Data, Brands Leverage New Strategies To Organize Information And Power Personalized Experiences
articles.description: In today's business world, companies are facing an overwhelming amount of customer data. To make sense of this information and turn it into actionable insights, brands are turning to AI and data tools that unify customer data in real-time.
articles.content:
Customer Data
AdobeStock_238240773
In today's business world, companies are facing an overwhelming amount of customer data. To make sense of this information and turn it into actionable insights, b… [+4956 chars]
articles.summary:
1. Brands collect massive amounts of customer data but struggle to organize and leverage it effectively.
2. New strategies such as customer data platforms (CDPs) and artificial intelligence (AI) assist in organizing and analyzing data.
3. The result is better personalization of customer experiences and increased customer loyalty.

articles.author: Louis Columbus
articles.title: Getting cyber-resilience right in a zero-trust world starts at the endpoint
articles.description: Absolute has released its 2023 Resilience Index, showing what's driving the trend that balances security and cyber-resilience.
articles.content:
Join top executives in San Francisco on July 11-12, to hear how leaders are integrating and optimizing AI investments for success. Learn More
With the White House announcing a new national cybersecu… [+1696 chars]
articles.summary:
1. Cyber resilience is critical in a zero-trust world, which means that endpoints such as laptops and mobile devices must be secured.
2. Endpoint security should be designed to protect against both known and unknown threats, such as zero-day attacks.
3. Organizations should implement a layered approach that integrates endpoint protection with other security measures, such as network segmentation and identity and access management.

articles.title: 4 Ways Leaders Should Reevaluate Their Cybersecurity's Focus
articles.description: In this article, I will outline four ways leaders can better protect their raw data.
articles.content:
Chief Executive Officer at Active Cypher.
getty
Despite business leaders' growing awareness of cybercrimeand the rapid adaptations offered by new cybersecurity architecturescriminals continue to su… [+7087 chars]
articles.summary:
1. Leaders should re-evaluate their cybersecurity focus to stay ahead of emerging threats.
2. Cybersecurity should be integrated into all business functions to ensure comprehensive protection.
3. Collaboration and communication between IT and non-IT staff is essential for effective cybersecurity measures.

articles.title: How Can Advertisers Navigate Further Without Cookies?
articles.description: The cookieless world is an environment where users are in control of their data and must give explicit consent for its use. Also, tracking restrictions are applied globally to enable privacy-centric browsing experiences for every user.
articles.content:
Founder and CEO of SegmentStream, a Conversion Modelling Platform that solves marketing analytics in a cookieless world. 
getty
The advertisers life is changing to be harder. With all current track… [+6323 chars]
articles.summary:
1. Advertisers must find new ways to reach and engage with consumers without relying on cookies.
2. Strategies such as targeted advertising based on first-party data and contextual advertising are key.
3. Collaboration and cooperation among industry players can help to develop new solutions for effective advertising post-cookie.
